page.title: 03Shaugh Prior Church.
page.content: {St.Edward's Church }was a small chapel until the present church was erected. It was built between the late 14th and the early 16th century.On the west side of the church there is a wooden font where babies are christened.It was found in a barn rotting away.It was repaired and brought back to the church for use.There is also a bishop's chair where important visitors sit.On the west side of the church are the bells.The oldest grave stone dates back to the 18th century. Behind the church there are newer graves and now they use the field next to the church as a graveyard.{ {St.Edwards}is the parish church for the villages of{Shaugh Prior,Lee Moor and{Wotter.}It is the only church in our "D" block.
